    • Method Detail

      • createBitcoinWallet

        public static BitcoinWallet createBitcoinWallet(org.bitcoinj.core.NetworkParameters params,
                                                org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey clientPubKey_1,
                                                org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey clientPubKey_2,
                                                org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey serverPrivKey)
        Create the bitcoin wallet. The only method to create the bitcoin wallet. This is the 2-of-3 multisig. To export public key from ECKey, we can use method: ECKey.getPubKey(): byte[] To import public key, we can use function: ECKey.fromPublicOnly(byte[] pub): ECKey To export private key from ECKey, we can use method: ECKey.getPrivateKeyEncoded(NetworkParameters params).toBase58(): String with: NetworkParameters params: the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...) To import private key, we can use function: DumpedPrivateKey.fromBase58(NetworkParameters params, String base58): ECKey with: NetworkParameters params: the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...) String base58: the private key in String format IMPORTANT: The bitcoin wallet created from (A,B,C) is different from the one created from (B,A,C). So remember the order of the keys.
        Parameters:
        params - the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...)
        clientPubKey_1 - the first client public key
        clientPubKey_2 - the second client public key
        serverPrivKey - the server private key
        Returns:
        the bitcoin wallet object

      • getServerPrivKey

        public org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey getServerPrivKey(org.bitcoinj.core.NetworkParameters params)
        Get the server private key of the bitcoin wallet
        Parameters:
        params - the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...)
        Returns:
        the server private key

      • createRawTx

        public org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction createRawTx(org.bitcoinj.core.NetworkParameters params,
                                                 java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutput> UTxOs,
                                                 java.util.List<org.springframework.data.util.Pair<org.bitcoinj.core.Address,org.bitcoinj.core.Coin>> candidates,
                                                 org.bitcoinj.core.Coin feePerKb)
                                          throws org.bitcoinj.core.InsufficientMoneyException
        Return the raw transaction which has transaction outputs and unsigned transaction inputs This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. IMPORTANT: 1 KB = 1000 bytes RECOMMENDED: feePerKb = Coin.valueOf(1000) 1000 satoshis/KB
        Parameters:
        params - the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...)
        UTxOs - the list of unspent transaction outputs
        candidates - the list of pairs which Coin is the amount we want to send to Address
        feePerKb - the price of transaction (fee per KB)
        Returns:
        the raw transaction
        Throws:
        org.bitcoinj.core.InsufficientMoneyException - when the input sum is not enough to send, it will throw this exception

      • createRawTxHashes

        public java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.core.Sha256Hash> createRawTxHashes(org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction rawTx)
        Return the list of transaction hashes. This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. To be able to send the transaction, the client MUST sign them.
        Parameters:
        rawTx - the raw transaction after created by the create2of3MultiSigRawTx function.
        Returns:
        the list of transaction hashes

      • signAndSendTx

        public java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutput> signAndSendTx(com.msgilligan.bitcoinj.rpc.BitcoinClient client,
                                                                         org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction rawTx,
                                                                         java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.crypto.TransactionSignature> userTxSign)
        Complete and send the transaction (if possible). This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. After receiving the list of transaction signatures, the server will add them, complete and send the transaction.
        Parameters:
        client - the bitcoin client object
        rawTx - the raw transaction
        userTxSign - the list of transaction signatures
        Returns:
        the completed transaction
